description: Manage delivery rule conditions for an endpoint.

commands.name: az cdn endpoint rule condition add
commands.summary: Add a condition to a delivery rule.
commands.syntax:
az cdn endpoint rule condition add --match-variable {ClientPort, Cookies, HostName, HttpVersion, IsDevice, PostArgs, QueryString, RemoteAddress, RequestBody, RequestHeader, RequestMethod, RequestScheme, RequestUri, ServerPort, SocketAddr, SslProtocol, UrlFileExtension, UrlFileName, UrlPath}
                                   --operator
                                   --rule-name
                                   [--ids]
                                   [--match-values]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--negate-condition {false, true}]
                                   [--profile-name]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--selector]
                                   [--subscription]
                                   [--transform {Lowercase, Uppercase}]
examples: az cdn endpoint rule condition add -g group -n endpoint --profile-name profile --rule-name name --match-variable RemoteAddress --operator GeoMatch --match-values "TH"

commands.name: az cdn endpoint rule condition remove
commands.summary: Remove a condition from a delivery rule.
commands.syntax:
az cdn endpoint rule condition remove --index
                                      --rule-name
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--profile-name]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
examples: az cdn endpoint rule condition remove -g group -n endpoint --profile-name profile --rule-name name --index 0

commands.name: az cdn endpoint rule condition show
commands.summary: Show delivery rules associate with the endpoint.
commands.syntax:
az cdn endpoint rule condition show [--ids]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--profile-name]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--subscription]
examples: az cdn endpoint rule condition show -g group -n endpoint --profile-name profile-name
